name: Zhouxing Shi
content: Zhouxing Shi Zhouxing Shi Assistant Professor at UC Riverside I am an Assistant Professor at Department of Computer Science and Engineering, University of California, Riverside. I completed Ph.D. at UCLA Computer Science Department in 2025, advised by Prof. Cho-Jui Hsieh. I received my B.Eng. degree from the CST department at Tsinghua University in 2020. My research focus is on machine learning (ML), especially developing more trustworthy and reliable AI models. Specifically, some of my current interests include but are not limited to: the interplay between generative AI, verifiers and formal methods; robustness and safety for state-of-the-art ML models; formal verification for ML; training verifiable ML models with guarantees; applications of verifiable ML in mission-critical scenarios.
